arts.ttl: Nathan Jones delighted as Charlton Athletic extend excellent home form with win over Barnsley to climb to 5th
arts.sum: Macaulay Gillesphey caught Tykes keeper Jackson Smith out with a low, curling free-kick that snuck in at the near-post on 12 minutes – a strike that proved to be the match winner as the Addicks kept a sixth clean sheet in seven on home turf. It’s a real squad game but we were excellent second half.

arts.ttl: Macauley Gillesphey is Charlton’s matchwinner against Barnsley
arts.sum: The Addicks strengthened their grip on a play-off place with the 1-0 victory.

arts.ttl: “This is my home” – Player happy with choice after last minute Barnsley cancellation in summer
arts.sum: Go Ahead Eagles striker Victor Edvardsen has insisted he’s happy where he is after a failed move to Barnsley in the summer transfer window. De Stentor have an interview with the 29-year-old striker today in which his failed move to Barnsley get’s a brief mention. He’s been with Go Ahead Eagles since a €700,000 move The post “This is my home” – Player happy with choice after last minute Barnsley cancellation in summer appeared first on Sport Witness.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic have possibility of moving fifth in League One after midweek action
arts.sum: Seventh-placed Bolton Wanderers have a tough home assignment against runaway leaders Birmingham City while Leyton Orient, who lost 2-1 at home to the Addicks on Saturday, head to a Rotherham side who are 14th. Charlton have taken 13 points from a possible 18 – form mirrored by Stockport and Bolton.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic sell out again in League One - 1,193 will roar on Nathan Jones’ side at Stockport County
arts.sum: Charlton Athletic have sold out their away allocation for Saturday’s League One fixture against Stockport County. Stockport have won their last four home matches.
